Description: Solid-cast copper alloy figure of the Apis Bull wearing the sun-disc; decorated with silver inlay: a triangle on the forehead, a winged scarab at the back of the neck and a vulture on the rump.
Curator's comments: Published: Barcelona, Toros/Bulls, p.312, Cat. No.13. = The Bull in the Mediterranean World, Athens 2003, pp.156 -157 [13].
Bibliographic references: Barcelona 2002 / The Bull in the Mediterranean World (cat.13, p.156)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: Exhibition: "The Bull in the Ancient World / Bulls: Image and Cult in the ancient Mediterranean", Salo del Tinell, Barcelona, 14 Nov 2002-13 Feb 2003; then Benaki Museum, Athens, 14 Nov 2002-7 Jun 2003. Exhibition: 'A son of Luxor's sands', Carmarthen Museum, Jun-Oct 1986. 2007/08 Nov-Jan, BM, Room 3, Divine Cat: Speaking to the gods in ancient Egypt
